keyword: how many calories in 4 oz of chicken
title: How Many Calories in 4 oz of Chicken?
meta_description: Learn how many calories in 4 oz of chicken, plus detailed nutrition like protein, fat, carbs, and tweaks for variations in preparation.
h1: How Many Calories in 4 oz of Chicken?
assumptions: Boneless, skinless chicken breast, cooked (roasted or grilled), no added oil, seasonings, or sauces; 4 oz ≈ 113 g.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by cut, cooking method, added ingredients, and exact weight. Check labels or use a food scale for precision.

quick_answer.text: 4 oz of cooked, skinless chicken breast provides about 187 kcal and 35 g protein.

label_note: Totals are scaled from the per-100 g basis and mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tsp oil for cooking per 4 oz

faqs.q: How many calories are in 4 oz of cooked chicken breast?
faqs.a: Approximately 187 kcal for boneless, skinless, cooked chicken breast.

faqs.q: What is the protein content in 4 oz of chicken?
faqs.a: About 35 g of protein, making it a high-protein, low-carb option.

faqs.q: Does the type of chicken affect calories in 4 oz?
faqs.a: Yes—thighs or skin-on have more fat and calories than breast; assumptions here are for breast.

faqs.q: Are these calories for raw or cooked chicken?
faqs.a: Cooked weight; raw 4 oz would be higher in water content, yielding less after cooking.

faqs.q: How does cooking method change calories in 4 oz chicken?
faqs.a: Grilling or roasting keeps it low; frying or adding oil/breading can add 40–100+ kcal.
